headline: Rants and Raves | March 23, 2022
sentences: St. Patrick’s Day is celebrated in bars and restaurants and it’s not a reflection on the Irish; just a matter of keeping inebriated drivers off the road.
– Most regular fast-food eaters also buy already-prepared store foods you nuke at home; most filled with additives, preservatives, sugar and other crap.
Kingman police to provide extra patrols St. Patrick’s Day weekend rant – Extra police patrols aren’t about you and your sober Irish family.
Saturday evening a family was walking across Beale Street and four of those scooters ran right through the middle of them.
Poll: “Would you be willing to pay a property tax to fund street repairs and maintenance in the City of Kingman?” – No.
Unlike your predecessors who ignored our pleas for the past 35 years, you listened to us and responded to our needs.
Thanks Sen. Mark Kelly for earmarking the funds for a much-needed flood control project on Bank Street.
One of the uglier aspects of some neighborhoods is the forest of poles and wires strung everywhere.
UniSource invests $8M – How many residences could $8 million go for undergrounding their services?
Barillaro brings a world of experience to county libraries – Our library is a fabulous resource.
Our library helps people access private, government resources and info local to international.
Five-year-old dies in ATV crash – No 5-year-old child should be operating a motor vehicle.
Submit Rants and Raves at kdminer.com/rants-and-raves or email editorial@kdminer.com.
I hope the arrogant morons that think it’s all a lefty fake news story are right.
If your rant/rave is about a specific story please mention the headline.
– I don’t eat fast food often, but when I do the meal lasts me all day.
When traveling I can access audio and e books anywhere in the world.
Hey, City of Kingman, you need to do something with these scooters!
When I stay home and eat healthy I’m hungry again within six hours.
These people, overall, don’t take good care of themselves, period.
Building permits – Where is the water going to come from?
Everyone benefits from better roads, not just homeowners.

Tragic event that could have been prevented.
I found that I lose weight when I eat out.
Some look as if they are ready to fall.
Local rants and raves are preferred.

That’s the real problem.
Birdland needs this.
Maybe a sales tax.
I’m satisfied.
